sentences.en: A beginning beard faintly shadowed his chin and lean cheeks.
sentences.cn: 从他的下巴和瘦削的面颊上可以依稀看到刚长出来的胡须.

sentences.en: A faintly comic figure, he fears ridicule above all else.
sentences.cn: 他是个不怎么滑稽的人物, 最害怕被人嘲笑.

sentences.en: From the hall the clock calling out the quarter hour, then a moment of stillness - time stalling - before, faintly, the clock in her study responded.
sentences.cn: 客厅传来钟表敲打刻点的声音，接下来是短暂的静止——时间的停止，直到书房里的钟表微弱地做出了回应。

sentences.en: From the slope below, the wild goats bleated faintly.
sentences.cn: 山坡下面，野山羊咩咩地轻声叫着。

sentences.en: He is a faintly comical figure who fears being made fun of.
sentences.cn: 他是个害怕被别人取笑的有点儿滑稽的人物.

sentences.en: He stroked his beautiful white beard, and smiled faintly.
sentences.cn: 他捋了一把他那美丽的白髯, 淡淡地笑了一笑.

sentences.en: He was already asleep in the bed, which smelled faintly of mildew.
sentences.cn: 他已经在略带霉味的床上睡着了。

sentences.en: Her insignificance in the presence of so much magnificence faintly affected her.
sentences.cn: "她想象着他所描绘的一切,心里不禁有些刺痛.
她的声音略带一丝嘲弄。

sentences.en: Hugh and John were exchanging faintly barbed courtesies.
sentences.cn: 休和约翰正说着带有相互挤兑意味的客气话。

sentences.en: John smiled faintly and shook his head.
sentences.cn: 约翰微微笑了笑，摇了摇头。

sentences.en: Now, slowly and at first faintly an opposite tendency is showing itself.
sentences.cn: 现在, 一种相反的趋势正在慢慢地而且起初不易为人觉察地显示出来.
她看上去有点被逗乐了.

sentences.en: The moon glimmered faintly through the mists.
sentences.cn: 月亮透过薄雾洒下微光。

sentences.en: The still air smelt faintly of furniture polish.
sentences.cn: 凝滞的空气中隐隐有股家具上光剂的味道。

words.tran_cn: 模糊的；头晕的；虚弱的；[医] 衰弱的
昏倒；变得微弱；变得没气力

trans.tran_cn: 微弱地，隐约地，虚弱地，有点
